page.title: 04THE AVENUES, BENTLEY
page.content:
The approach to the church of St Mary is through a short avenue of ancient yew trees. The two nearest the church have been cut down whilst conducting this survey. When seen by Gilbert White in 1793 they were then thought to be between 200 and 300 years old. Their age and the spread of their lower branches being so great and so heavy they are now supported by an arbour like structure of heavy timbers.
The avenue of lime trees leading from the church to Bury Court were planted early in the 19C. and are a most magnificent sight.
Dutch elm disease decimated one other fine avenue which has now been totally removed.
